text: The Timshor (, also: Timsher) is a river in Perm Krai, Russia, a right tributary of the South Keltma.Timshor in encyclopedia of Perm Krai It is long, with drainage basin of .«Река Тимшор», Russian State Water Registry It starts in the northwestern part of Perm Krai, in Gaynsky District, near the border with the Komi Republic. It flows into the South Keltma from the larger river's mouth. There are many swamps and lakes along the river. Main tributaries: * Left: Okos, Chepets; * Right: My, Bortom. ==References== Category:Rivers of Perm Krai
title: Timshor
